title: Ravens' Tyler Loop reacts to missed FG vs. Steelers with strong quote
description: Loop had the fate of the entire season on his right boot.
fullText:
Ravens' Tyler Loop reacts to missed FG vs. Steelers with strong quote originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

After the ups and downs the Baltimore Ravens had to endure in the 2025 season, their entire year came down to a 44-yard field goal attempt from Tyler Loop in Week 18 to keep their season alive.

After Lamar Jackson had driven the Ravens to the Steelers' 26-yard line with time running out,¬†the score at 26-24, a field goal was set up to send Baltimore to the playoffs as division champs.

Up stepped rookie kicker Loop, who had the entire Ravens season resting on his right boot.

And unfortunately, Tyler's kick sailed far right, and the Ravens' season ended, with the Steelers rolling on to the playoffs.

‚ÄúJust for a time like that sucks, I want to do better, and unfortunately, the nature of the job is, you have makes, those are awesome, and unfortunately you have misses,‚Äù Loop said. ‚ÄúFor that to happen sucks. We've been through a lot of adversity this year as a team early on, we fought, we've worked really hard together, those guys have had my back, and I want to try my best to have theirs.

"It's disappointing, and it sucks, but also the nature of the job is I got to move on, and I got to get ready for the next kick.‚Äù

More:Lamar Jackson's brilliant Ravens return spoiled as Super Bowl drought continues

Thought to be a Super Bowl contender before the season began, to miss out on the playoffs altogether, something has to change.

Another year of failure for Baltimore has some wondering whether this should be the end of the road for John Harbaugh as head coach.

That is certainly a conversation starter, no doubt, and it is one of a host of talks that have to take place over the coming months as the Ravens go through the wreckage that is the 2025 season.

It started horribly and ended just as badly.

Todd Bowles gives outstanding response over Buccaneers future

Bills reveal how they can slay Jaguars in wild-card round

Chiefs fans will love Andy Reid's quote on 2026 outlook

Shocking stat shows Bills must break three-decade long playoff drought vs. Jags

title: Did Travis Kelce Retire From NFL, Chiefs After Week 18 Loss?
description: The biggest question in football was asked last night to Travis Kelce, and he had an answer.
fullText:
After Travis Kelce exited the field solemnly on Sunday night in Las Vegas after the Kansas City Chiefs fell for the final time this NFL season, there was one question on every fan, pundit, and probably even player‚Äôs mind:

Was that the last game Travis Kelce ever played?

On Monday, we have somewhat of an answer, albeit one many fans might not have wanted to hear.

Following the team‚Äôs game, Kelce shuffled into the locker room and was faced with questions from the media about his future plans with the Chiefs and if he had already decided on his future.

Kelce admitted that after the Chiefs' Super Bowl loss last year, he instantly knew he would be back with the Chiefs the next season. He wasn‚Äôt going to let his career end that way, and he was motivated that night to return to play with the only franchise he‚Äôs ever known.

After the Raiders' loss, however, he was much more split. He explained that he doesn‚Äôt know at the moment when he will decide what he will do for the rest of the year regarding football.

One of the most successful players on and off the field, Kelce is scheduled to marry his partner, world pop star Taylor Swift, this coming June in Rhode Island.

He also hosts one of the most popular podcasts in North America, ‚ÄúNew Heights‚Äù with his brother, retired NFL lineman and fellow Super Bowl champion Jason Kelce.

Even Travis‚Äô mother, Donna, is set to make her big television debut in only a few days on ‚ÄúThe Traitors,‚Äù a competitive reality show produced by NBC on Peacock.

We will keep you updated on Kelce‚Äôs decision on whether he will play his 14th season in the NFL or if Sunday was his last dance.

This article originally appeared on Touchdown Wire: Did Travis Kelce Retire From NFL, Chiefs After Week 18 Loss?

title: Do the Vikings know if McCarthy is worth committing to? His bruising, unsteady debut left a mystery
description: The Minnesota Vikings lost their bet this season that they could develop J.J. McCarthy and still win at the same time, with a roster strong enough to withstand the typical inconsistencies of a young quarterback in his debut.  The Vikings have begun a new year with yet another quarterback quandary, a familiar scenario for this star-crossed franchise.  Asked after the final game on Sunday if he would be comfortable entering next season with McCarthy as the starter, coach Kevin O'Connell sidestepped the question.
fullText:
EAGAN, Minn. (AP) ‚Äî The Minnesota Vikings lost their bet this season that they could develop J.J. McCarthy and still win at the same time, with a roster strong enough to withstand the typical inconsistencies of a young quarterback in his debut.

The worst part of their failed gamble for 2025 was that it left plenty more mystery for 2026. The Vikings have begun a new year with yet another quarterback quandary, a familiar scenario for this star-crossed franchise.

Asked after the final game on Sunday if he would be comfortable entering next season with McCarthy as the starter, coach Kevin O'Connell sidestepped the question.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt wait to work with him in the offseason and absolutely look forward to the continued development and improvement," O'Connell said, "and I‚Äôm excited where he‚Äôs ending the season and know there‚Äôs some things we can really dive into as a group.‚Äù

The Vikings made sure not to miss out on the record quarterback rush at the top of the 2024 draft, confidently selecting McCarthy with the 10th pick as the promising prospect for their reputable system they could mold into a long-term fixture at this vital and vexing position.

But his injuries have put them behind on the evaluation. The fact that he has only started 10 games and finished eight over his first two years is the most concerning of any metric. Even when he was healthy, the struggles with accuracy were pronounced enough to make them consider alternatives despite the significant upside on display.

After winging it with Carson Wentz and Max Brosmer as the backups, at the very least the Vikings realize they need better depth if they're going to run McCarthy back next season. McCarthy, for his part, sounded aware that his hold on the starting job is tenuous, too.

"There‚Äôs nothing promised. That‚Äôs something I take very seriously. It‚Äôs not something you buy and you get for the rest of your life. You rent it and you lease it every single day, and I‚Äôm just trying to make daily deposits and make sure I‚Äôm in this house for a long time.‚Äù

Finishing with a five-game winning streak put the Vikings (9-8) a half-game behind Green Bay for the last spot even though they were eliminated before taking the field in Week 14.

Consider this: If the Vikings just had better coverage on their kickoff after McCarthy's go-ahead touchdown pass in the final minute in Week 11, when Devin Duvernay's 56-yard return set Chicago up for the walk-off field goal, they would've won that game ‚Äî and the NFC North title.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to sting not being in the tournament for not only our team and the work that they‚Äôve put in, but our fan base and our ownership,‚Äù O'Connell said.

The Vikings still took third in the division on a tiebreaker over Detroit, meaning a road game next season against San Francisco (12-5) instead of Arizona (3-14) from the NFC West and home games against Indianapolis (8-9) instead of Tennessee (3-14) from the AFC South and Washington (5-12) instead of New York (4-13) from the NFC East.

The Vikings were able to get Justin Jefferson past the 1,000-yard mark for the sixth straight season to start his career, but the fact that he needed all 17 games to do that was ultimately one of many poor statistical reflections on this once-potent offense.

The Vikings were last in the NFL in turnovers, interceptions and third down conversions and second-to-last in sack percentage.

The Vikings had another stellar performance under the direction of defensive coordinator Brian Flores, finishing second in red zone touchdown rate and sack percentage and third in the league in yards allowed. They were seventh in points against, one of only two teams in the top 13 in the NFL to miss the playoffs, along with Kansas City.

Flores will again be a candidate for head coach vacancies around the league, and his contract is expiring, too, raising the question about whether he will return. The scene at U.S. Bank Stadium on Sunday felt like a farewell to 14-year veteran safety Harrison Smith, too. Salary cap management will likely force the Vikings to move from one or both of the veteran defensive linemen they signed this season, Jonathan Allen and Javon Hargrave.

The quarterback search will be complicated by an unfavorable salary cap situation, with the Vikings carrying the second-highest projected overage in the league into the offseason and thus needing to shed multiple important players before they can add new ones. More depth is needed on the offensive line, too, with the future of center Ryan Kelly in doubt after multiple concussions.

In the draft, they have the 18th pick in the first round and still possess their original second and third-round selections. They currently own five third-day picks and are in line to be awarded mid-round compensatory selections for the departure of free agent quarterbacks Sam Darnold and Daniel Jones last year.

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/NFL

title: Rockets C Alperen ≈ûeng√ºn to miss up to 2 weeks after suffering sprained ankle in loss to Mavericks
description: ≈ûeng√ºn's right ankle rolled hard while he was trying to get a rebound in the opening minute of the Rockets' loss Saturday.
fullText:
The Houston Rockets expect to be without All-Star center Alperen ≈ûeng√ºn for up to two weeks.

≈ûeng√ºn went down with a right ankle injury very early in the team‚Äôs 110-104 loss to the Dallas Mavericks on Saturday. While he doesn‚Äôt have a specific timeline for his return ‚Äî the team is planning to evaluate ≈ûeng√ºn again in the coming days ‚Äî head coach Ime Udoka confirmed Monday that ≈ûeng√ºn will likely miss up to two weeks.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll evaluate him at the end of the week,‚Äù Udoka said, via Sports Illustrated‚Äôs Lachard Binkley. ‚ÄúNeed to get the swelling, the pain tolerance down and mobility, but you‚Äôre looking at a probably 10-14 days type thing.‚Äù

[Get more Rockets news: Houston team feed]

Roughly a minute into the game Saturday at the American Airlines Center, ≈ûeng√ºn went up to try to fight for a defensive rebound against Mavericks center Daniel Gafford. As ≈ûeng√ºn came down, his right ankle rolled hard. That sent him crashing to the court, where he remained until play stopped at the other end.

This is the play where Alperen Sengun got hurt, rolling his right ankle when landing on a rebound attempt. https://t.co/vEohvYuD61 pic.twitter.com/VVxGTjqmQh

‚Äî ClutchFans (@clutchfans) January 4, 2026

≈ûeng√ºn eventually limped off the court and was quickly ruled out of the game.

He is in the middle of a career season with the Rockets. The 23-year-old, who made his first All-Star Game last year, has put up a career-high 21.8 points this season while averaging 9 rebounds and 6.5 assists.

While this will interrupt his dominant start to the season, and ≈ûeng√ºn has a history of ankle injuries, the timeline this time seems relatively minor. If ≈ûeng√ºn is out the full two weeks, he'd be back in time for the team‚Äôs matchup with the San Antonio Spurs on Jan. 20, meaning he would miss eight games.

The Rockets enter Monday night‚Äôs contest against the Phoenix Suns with a 21-11 record, which has them fifth in the Western Conference standings. Saturday‚Äôs loss to the Mavericks snapped a four-game winning streak.

title: NFL: Half of the top 10 highest-paid QBs missed the playoffs, but their big contracts weren't the problem
description: The alternative to paying a premium price for a high-end quarterback isn‚Äôt pretty.
fullText:
The NFL playoff field is set, and it's missing half of the league's top 10 highest-paid quarterbacks in average annual value.

Spotrac made note of that fact on Monday, a day after the dust settled on the NFL's regular season. Of the league's top 10 paid quarterbacks, Josh Allen, Trevor Lawrence, Jordan Love, Brock Purdy and Justin Herbert are all in the postseason.

Dak Prescott, Joe Burrow, Tua Tagovailoa, Jared Goff and Lamar Jackson are not.

Half of the Top 10 Average Paid QBs made the playoffs - half didn't.

Dak Prescott ‚ùå
Josh Allen ‚úÖ
Joe Burrow ‚ùå
Trevor Lawrence ‚úÖ
Jordan Love ‚úÖ
Tua Tagovailoa ‚ùå
Jared Goff ‚ùå
Brock Purdy ‚úÖ
Justin Herbert ‚úÖ
Lamar Jackson ‚ùå

‚Äî Spotrac (@spotrac) January 5, 2026

Which got us to thinking. Are teams hamstringing their playoff chances in a salary-capped league by paying premiums for quarterbacks? Is it too difficult in the modern NFL to build a competitive roster around a quarterback playing on a premium salary?

Quarterback is the most important position in football, if not in all of sports. It's difficult to win a Super Bowl without a high-end signal caller, though Super Bowls have been won with Nick Foles, Jeff Hostetler, Jim Plunkett, Brad Johnson and Trent Dilfer.

But having a Patrick Mahomes, Tom Brady, Peyton Manning or Joe Montana is historically the best ingredient for success. And they cost money.

Here's a look at the salaries of starting quarterbacks for all 32 NFL teams, grouped by whether or not they made the playoffs. Players with a top-10 salary are in bold.

Caleb Williams: $9.9 million (rookie contract)

Bryce Young: $9.5 million (rookie contract)

Drake Maye: $9.2 million (rookie contract)

C.J. Stroud: $9.1 million (rookie contract)

Bo Nix: $4.7 million (rookie contract)

Dak Prescott, Cowboys: $60 million

Joe Burrow, Bengals: $55 million

Tua Tagovailoa, Dolphins: $53.1 million

Lamar Jackson, Ravens: $52 million

Kyler Murray, Cardinals: $46.1 million

Kirk Cousins, Falcons: $45 million

Patrick Mahomes, Chiefs: $45 million

Geno Smith, Raiders: $37.5 million

Baker Mayfield, Buccaneers: $33.3 million

Justin Fields, Jets: $20 million

Daniel Jones, Colts: $14 million

Cam Ward, Titans: $12.2 million (rookie contract)

Jayden Daniels, Commanders: $9.4 million (rookie contract)

J.J. McCarthy, Vikings: $5.5 million (rookie contract)

Jaxson Dart, Giants: $4.2 million (rookie contract)

Tyler Shough, Saints: $2.7 million (rookie contract)

Shedeur Sanders, Browns: $1.2 million (rookie contract)

It's notable that five of the 12 playoff quarterbacks are playing on rookie contracts, which are capped by the collective bargaining agreement.

That cost control is extremely valuable, and optimizing roster construction around rookie quarterback contracts is a proven formula for success. Since the inception of the rookie wage scale in 2011, the Seattle Seahawks with Russell Wilson (2014 season) and the Kansas City Chiefs with Mahomes (2019 season) have navigated the rookie wage scale to Super Bowl victories.

This, season, the Patriots have an MVP candidate in Maye who's the ninth-highest paid player on the team. Nix playing on a $4.7 million salary has allowed the Broncos to build a Super Bowl contender despite Wilson's disastrous contract remaining on the books.

Stroud, meanwhile is a veteran quarterback in his third season who's surrounded by one of the NFL's fiercest defenses. It would not be a surprise to see any of them playing in or winning the Super Bowl in January.

This is an optimal way to build a Super contender in the short window available to pay quarterbacks on a rookie contract. This, of course, requires hitting successfully on a quarterback in the draft who can lead a team to contention at a young age.

And it's also, obviously, not the only path to success. Thirteen of the 15 Super Bowls won since the inception of the rookie wage scale have been won by quarterbacks not playing on a rookie deal.

At some point, those rookie quarterbacks will be due for extensions. And if you've got a high-end quarterback on your hands who's due to be paid, there's little choice but to pay him. And that doesn't mean that you can't build a successful roster around said quarterback.

Yes, half of the top 10 paid quarterbacks will be watching the playoffs from home. But it's a little absurd to suggest that that's an indictment of paying top quarterbacks their market value.

Burrow missed most of the season due to injury. Do the Bengals have also roster construction issues? Absolutely. But that's an issue that's plagued the franchise for pretty much the entirety of its existence under Brown family ownership, with or without a premium quarterback on the roster.

The Cowboys likewise have roster concerns that limited their upside. Like with the Bengals, it's fairer to take a look at the decades-long management under Jerry Jones (and the defense specifically this year) than point to the $60 million salary of Prescott, who was excellent this season, to explain why the Cowboys aren't in the playoffs.

It's difficult to argue that the Lions and Ravens didn't build strong rosters around Goff and Jackson. There's talent on both sides of the ball on both teams outside of their quarterbacks. And Jackson was clearly limited by injuries this season, while the Lions were ravaged by injuries of their own.

In the end, 14 of the league's 32 teams make the playoffs. The Ravens and Lions just missed out, but it wouldn't be a surprise for either or both to return to contention next season.

And then there's Tagovailoa. His contract at this point was pretty clearly a mistake. He got benched at the end of the season, and his time in Miami very well may be done. The Dolphins would surely take a do-over on his deal of they could.

But the Prescott, Jackson, Burrow and Goff deals? There are surely no regrets from their respective franchises. Teams without high-end quarterbacks would certainly jump at the chance to take their contracts on.

title: Report: Manchester City could pip Bayern Munich in Marc Gu√©hi race
description: FC Bayern could be too late to nab the English center-back from the Premier League.
fullText:
Bayern Munich‚Äôs reported long-standing interest in Crystal Palace defender Marc Gu√©hi could hit a snag: another top European club could beat it to the punch this month.

The German Rekordmeister had been tipped for contract talks with the English international, who is now in the final six months of his current deal and free to negotiate with other clubs as a free agent. However, a run of injuries to Pep Guardiola‚Äôs Manchester City defense has created the possibility of an immediate transfer, according to reporting in the BBC.

Manchester City are exploring a move for Marc Gu√©hi this month, in the wake of defenders Josko Gvardiol and Ruben Dias suffering injuries. Bayern, Real Madrid, Barcelona, Inter and Atl√©tico are among the European clubs to have shown an interest in signing Gu√©hi on a free transfer. Liverpool remain heavily interested. It is understood Crystal Palace would consider selling Gu√©hi this month to avoid the scenario of losing their captain for nothing come the end of the season. Market regulations mean he can sign a pre-agreement with an overseas club from this month [@SamiMokbel_BBC, @BBCSport]

Man City has dropped points again this weekend, this time to Chelsea, and is seeing its campaign to keep the pressure on Arsenal falter. The Gunners sit six points atop the league after 20 matchdays. Gu√©hi surely would not come cheap, but the incentives are aligning for all parties involved ‚Äî and Bayern is in no position at the moment to throw in a bid. If Pep wants Gu√©hi, it is hard to see this not happening.

title: Enzo Maresca: Berrada pushing for ex-Chelsea boss
description: After a difficult 14 months, Manchester United finally pulled the trigger on the Ruben Amorim era.While results have been underwhelming from the start, things came to a head after the head coach‚Äôs e...
fullText:
After a difficult 14 months, Manchester United finally pulled the trigger on the Ruben Amorim era.

While results have been underwhelming from the start, things came to a head after the head coach‚Äôs explosive comments following the Leeds game.

He called out director of football Jason Wilcox, while hinting at a lack of control both in terms of incomings as well as when choosing his style of play.

And after holding a meeting early on Monday to review what the Portuguese tactician said, INEOS finally decided to pull the plug.

Former United midfielder and current U18s boss Darren Fletcher has taken over on an interim basis, with Wilcox preparing a list of managerial targets.

The reliable Gianluca Di Marzio has revealed that recently-sacked Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca is on the Red Devils‚Äô radar.

His record in the Premier League with both City and Chelsea and the fact that he is a free agent should do his chances of taking over at Old Trafford a world of good.

He guided the Stamford Bridge side to the Conference League and Club World Cup titles, while also helping City win a treble in the 22/23 season.

The Italian manager‚Äôs connection with Omar Berrada could prove key, as the United CEO was the one who had brought him back to the Etihad to be Pep Guardiola‚Äôs assistant.

Interestingly, the report also reveals that the club will hold a meeting to discuss the viability of all the potential candidates on Tuesday.

‚ÄúEnzo Maresca is also on Manchester United‚Äôs list to replace R√∫ben Amorim.

‚ÄúThe Red Devils are now looking for another candidate to fill the bench and on the list is also Enzo Maresca, who finished his 2025 contract at Chelsea but is now free.

‚ÄúCEO Omar Berrada already has a strong connection with the Italian manager, as he was the one who brought him to Manchester City as Guardiola‚Äôs assistant.

‚ÄúOn Tuesday 6 January, Man Utd should resolve their doubts about the various candidates (Glasner is also among them).‚Äù

As relayed by The Peoples Person, United played a part in Maresca‚Äôs sacking. Now, after destabilising the Blues, United could land their ex-manager in one fell swoop.

It looked a certainty that the ex-Leicester City boss was heading back to Manchester City to replace Guardiola ahead of next summer, but United could offer an immediate job opportunity.

Feature image Clive Mason via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Former Michigan State WR commits to USF
description: A former Michigan State wide receiver has found his second school since leaving East Lansing, heading to USF.
fullText:
Transfer portal madness has taken over college football with players making moves from school to school. A former Spartan wide receiver has made his move in the transfer portal for the second time in his career.

Jaron Glover was a member of Michigan State's 2022 recruiting class, and he spent three seasons in East Lansing before moving on from the program. Glover went from East Lansing to Starkville, joining Mississippi State, but unfortunately, it did not go as planned, and Glover did not record a catch for the Bulldogs. Now, making one more transfer, Glover is heading to his home state to play for USF.

Glover, a native of Sarasota, Florida, is going back to his home to finish his collegiate career with the Bulls.

In three years with Michigan State, Glover appeared in 19 games, securing 30 catches for 455 yards and two touchdowns.

title: Ballard, Steichen getting another chance from Colts owners despite second-half collapse
description: Carlie Irsay-Gordon liked what she saw during her first 10 games as the Indianapolis Colts' co-owner.  Quarterback Daniel Jones and running back Jonathan Taylor played at MVP levels, coach Shane Steichen's offense operated at a historically efficient clip and general manager Chris Ballard pulled the trigger on a midseason trade to fill the team's most glaring need.  Then Jones tried to play through a fractured lower left leg, suffered a torn right Achilles tendon and the season unraveled quickly as a season-ending seven-game losing streak knocked Indy (8-9) out of the playoffs again.
fullText:
INDIANAPOLIS (AP) ‚Äî Carlie Irsay-Gordon liked what she saw during her first 10 games as the Indianapolis Colts' co-owner.

Quarterback Daniel Jones and running back Jonathan Taylor played at MVP levels, coach Shane Steichen's offense operated at a historically efficient clip and general manager Chris Ballard pulled the trigger on a midseason trade to fill the team's most glaring need.

Then Jones tried to play through a fractured lower left leg, suffered a torn right Achilles tendon and the season unraveled quickly as a season-ending seven-game losing streak knocked Indy (8-9) out of the playoffs again.

Yet in her most significant move since taking over the franchise's day-to-day operations from her late father, Jim, Irsay-Gordon ignored the urge ‚Äî and the calls from some fans ‚Äî to fire Ballard and Steichen and instead decided to give them another chance to replicate their early season success.

‚ÄúWe have been very clear with Chris and Shane that giving them another opportunity means that the sense of urgency for them to deliver and perform has never been higher,‚Äù Irsay-Gordon said. ‚ÄúChris and Shane are both capable of facing this challenge head on and finding a way to achieve the results our fans deserve, which is winning games, getting to the postseason and ultimately winning championships.‚Äù

It might have been easier for Irsay-Gordon to explain if she moved on from Ballard, who has two playoff appearances and one postseason win in his nine-year tenure, or Steichen, who's 25-26 in three seasons and has never made it to the playoffs. Or perhaps both following the historic second-half collapse.

Indy became the first team since the 1995 Oakland Raiders and just the sixth since the 1970 AFL-NFL merger to start 8-2 and not make the postseason.

Irsay-Gordon blames injuries for the second-half failures.

In addition to Jones, the Colts lost two-time All-Pro cornerback Sauce Gardner for most of the final five games because of a strained calf, 2023 All-Pro cornerback Charvarius Ward for most of the second half because of two concussions and three-time Pro Bowl defensive tackle DeForest Buckner for six of the final seven games because of a neck injury. The result: Indy's skid included four losses by six or fewer points.

And for that reason, Irsay-Gordon didn't see the need to start over in 2026. She said she made that decision last week.

‚ÄúWhat we saw in that first half, we were on a record pace, dominating offensively,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI think we just have to be able to face adversity better, and I believe in the team. I believe in the team and hope to stay healthier next season.‚Äù

Ballard again finds himself entering an offseason dealing with questions about the sport's most important position.

Before the injury, Jones was expected to cash in on a comeback season with a big-dollar contract. Instead, he'll enter free agency for a second straight season dealing with questions about his injury history and how quickly he'll return to the field ‚Äî likely decreasing his price tag.

‚ÄúI'd love to be back here,‚Äù Jones said. ‚ÄúI think it's a great organization and I've enjoyed being here. Obviously, there's a business side to it and I understand that, but I've really enjoyed being around these people.‚Äù

Steichen and Ballard also must decide what to do with the oft-injured Anthony Richardson, the No. 4 pick in the 2023 draft, who lost the starting job in training camp and wasn't even active after mid-October after fracturing the orbital bone near his eye in a bizarre pregame accident.

In his first two seasons, receiver Alec Pierce struggled to make a consistent impact. The last two years, he has produced the highest per-catch average among the league's qualifiers.

Now the soon-to-be free agency is likely to cash in. Pierce had 47 catches, his first 1,000-yard season (1,003) for a 21.3-yard average with six TDs this season while establishing himself as a favorite for three starting quarterbacks ‚Äî Jones, 44-year-old Philip Rivers and rookie Riley Leonard.

‚ÄúI guess it's more like being recruited because you actually have a say in it now,‚Äù Pierce said. ‚ÄúIt's ultimately my decision.‚Äù

Ward had three concussions in his first season with Indy, and the second ‚Äî suffered in a pregame collision with tight end Drew Ogletree ‚Äî prompted Ward to contemplate retirement.

He might be going through that process again after finishing the season on injured reserve with his third concussion.

‚ÄúI've got to talk to my family,‚Äù Ward said. ‚ÄúIf I walk away, I feel like I'd be happy. I'd have won a Super Bowl, made a whole lot of money, made the Pro Bowl, made All-Pro. I did everything I wanted to. So I feel like if I walk away, I won't regret it. I'm good."

Irsay-Gordon made it clear the sense of urgency next year is even higher next season and her comment is likely to resonate throughout the offseason as Ballard contemplates future moves. Steichen said he'll contemplate what went wrong late in games, late in the season and how he can get the Colts back to the postseason.

title: Mike McDaniel not closing door on Tua Tagovailoa's return, foresees 2026 QB competition
description: Tua Tagovailoa said Monday that a fresh start elsewhere would be "dope."
fullText:
Tua Tagovailoa said Monday that a fresh start elsewhere would be "dope." The Dolphins, though, have not decided on the quarterback's future.

Mike McDaniel said he will meet with Tagovailoa at 8 a.m. ET on Tuesday.

The coach said he "would not close the door" on Tagovailoa's return.

"First things first, I don't think anybody understands what it would be like to be through the wringer like he has," McDaniel said, via Hal Habib of the Palm Beach Post. "He‚Äôll have to work to get back to the results that we're used to seeing."

The Dolphins benched Tagovailoa after a Week 15 loss, with rookie seventh-round pick Quinn Ewers starting the final two games. Tagovailoa's 1,660 passing yards were his fewest since 2021 and his 15 interceptions were a career high.

Ewers will be part of the competition for the job in 2026. It remains to be seen whether Tagovailoa will be, though it seems likely the Dolphins will part ways.

He is owed $54 million guaranteed in 2026. The Dolphins could release him with a post-June 1 designation at the start of the new league year to split his $99.2 million cap charge over two years.

"In 2026, I think there will be competition for our starting quarterback," McDaniel said. "What that is and how it looks, that remains to be seen. It's the most important position on the football field."

title: Former Vanderbilt QB Jay Cutler attending FCS national title game at FirstBank Stadium
description: Jay Cutler, who became Vanderbilt's all-time leading passer during his playing days, attended the FCS national championship game on Jan. 5.
fullText:
Former Vanderbilt football quarterback Jay Cutler attended the FCS national championship game at the Commodores' FirstBank Stadium on Jan. 5.

Cutler was shown on the Vanderbilt video boards in a box seat before kickoff between Montana State and Illinois State.

Cutler became Vanderbilt's all-time leading passer during his time with the Commodores (2001-05). He was the SEC offensive player of the year as a senior.

He was selected in the first round (11th player overall) in the 2006 NFL Draft by the Denver Broncos. He was traded to the Chicago Bears in 2009 where he played through 2016 before finishing his career with the Miami Dolphins in 2017.

Cutler made the All-Pro team in 2008. He passed for 35,133 career yards and 227 touchdowns in the NFL.

Reach Mike Organ at 615-259-8021 or on X @MikeOrganWriter.

This article originally appeared on Nashville Tennessean: Former Vanderbilt football QB Jay Cutler at FCS national title game

title: Julian Edelman Names What He Loves Most About Drake Maye‚Äôs Game
description: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye had an impressive regular season and is in the running for MVP, which left former New England wide receiver Julian Edelman naming his favorite thing about Maye‚Äôs game. ‚ÄúHis attitude,‚Äù Edelman said Monday on ‚ÄúThe Herd‚Äù. ‚ÄúJust talking to people over there, everyone just talks about how he is so hungry [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye had an impressive regular season and is in the running for MVP, which left former New England wide receiver Julian Edelman naming his favorite thing about Maye‚Äôs game.

‚ÄúHis attitude,‚Äù Edelman said Monday on ‚ÄúThe Herd‚Äù. ‚ÄúJust talking to people over there, everyone just talks about how he is so hungry to be coached and to learn, and it translates to how he is playing. He looks so confident. He makes it look so easy.‚Äù

Maye is just in his second season in the NFL, but he plays like a seasoned veteran every week. Although he is still young and lacks postseason experience, the Patriots shouldn‚Äôt be counted out in the playoffs.

The AFC is lacking a lot of veteran quarterbacks in this postseason, with Patrick Mahomes, Lamar Jackson and Joe Burrow sitting at home. Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen could be the quarterback to beat in the AFC. However, Maye already beat him once this season and should‚Äôve beaten him again.

It will be interesting to see how Maye performs in the postseason. If he plays as he did throughout the season, there‚Äôs a strong chance that New England could be on its way to the Super Bowl.

Drake Maye Makes His Case For Why He Deserves To Be NFL MVP

title: ACC announces start time for UNC-Virginia basketball game
description: UNC and Virginia have a long, storied history against each other on the basketball court. Both rivals will tip-off mid-afternoon on Janaury 24.
fullText:
The ACC basketball season is underway and for the North Carolina Tar Heels, they are off to a 1-1 start in conference play.

UNC ( suffered a 97-83 setback at SMU on Saturday, but the Mustangs (12-2, 2-0 ACC) look every bit of a conference favorite themselves. North Carolina's schedule remains tough as it gets deeper into the 2026, with upcoming matchups against Wake Forest (January 10), at Stanford (Jan. 14), California (Jan. 17) and vs. Notre Dame (Jan. 21).

On Monday afternoon, UNC learned the start time for its toughest remaining game this month. The Tar Heels will tip off at 2 p.m. on Saturday, Jan. 24 against Virginia.

The Cavaliers (12-2, 1-1 ACC) are out to a hot start in Year One under Ryan Odom, who has a proven track record of success in stops at UMBC, Utah State and VCU. Leading the on-court charge for UVA are Belgian forward Thijs De Ridder, transfer Malik Thomas and Jacari White, plus freshman Chance Mallory.

The ACC has announced UNC's game at UVA on Saturday, Jan 24, will tip off at 2 pm and air on ESPN pic.twitter.com/7WUPd7Am2l

‚Äî Andrew Jones (@AJTarHeel247) January 5, 2026

North Carolina downed Virginia at home in February last year, 81-66, as part of its late-season run to the NCAA Tournament. UNC's last trip to Charlottesville, a 54-44 victory in February 2024, was its first road win in the "South's Oldest Rivalry" since 2012.

Though the Tar Heels and Cavaliers only matchup up once during regular season play, expect to see both these teams dancing come March. North Carolina knows how to beat good teams ‚Äì and UVA is another one of many on the schedule.

title: Weird Stat Could Actually Help Oilers With Mangiapane Trade
description: A peculiar stat could unlock an Andrew Mangiapane trade for the Oilers. Other teams might see his struggles as opportunity.
fullText:
Trade speculation around Andrew Mangiapane is heating up, and Elliotte Friedman believes it‚Äôs only a matter of time before the Edmonton Oilers move the winger. While the fit in Edmonton hasn‚Äôt worked as hoped, Friedman suggests a deal is very doable based on analytics, contract value, and league-wide interest.

Speaking on 32 Thoughts, Friedman noted Mangiapane‚Äôs poor PDO ‚Äî often viewed as a ‚Äúluck‚Äù stat ‚Äî could actually help the Oilers. Friedman wonders whether another team might see Mangiapane‚Äôs struggles as more circumstantial than skill-related, suggesting that another organization could view him as a bounce-back candidate. With one year remaining at $3.6 million, Friedman doesn‚Äôt expect Edmonton to have much trouble finding a trade partner.

To date, the Ducks have been linked, but new names recently popped up on Monday, suggesting the Detroit Red Wings and Winnipeg Jets might also be a fit.

Friedman compared Mangiapane‚Äôs situation to Mason Marchment, a player who struggled in one stop before thriving elsewhere. Sometimes players need a change of scenery, and Mangiapane has a proven scoring history that remains valuable.

The Anaheim Ducks have surfaced as a possible landing spot, largely due to their cap flexibility and recent struggles. Friedman believes Anaheim may look to add or retain veterans, especially with Frank Vatrano sidelined long-term, to help stabilize a young roster.

With that in mind, Friedman poured cold water on rumors involving Ryan Strome coming back to Edmonton. Strome earns roughly $1.5 million more than Mangiapane, and the Oilers don‚Äôt have the cap space to make that work. More importantly, Strome isn‚Äôt the type of bottom-six, role-accepting player Edmonton is targeting.

Instead, the Oilers are reportedly seeking a grinder-type forward willing to play limited minutes and embrace a depth role ‚Äî something Mangiapane has been trending toward but seems less-than-thrilled about doing. It's reportedly why he's open to a trade in the first place -- to go where there is more opportunity to play a more prominent role.

Toronto has also been loosely connected due to Brad Treliving‚Äôs history with Mangiapane, but Friedman doesn‚Äôt see that as a realistic option.

Bottom line: Edmonton will find a landing spot for Mangiapane. The only question is where and when.

title: Defensive lineman DK Kalu commits to Florida Gators
description: Florida is adding depth to the defensive line. Baylor DL transfer DK Kalu committed to the Gators on Monday.
fullText:
Former Baylor redshirt sophomore defensive tackle DK Kalu has committed to the Florida Gators.

Kalu announced his decision on Monday, Jan. 5, joining former teammate DJ Coleman in moving from Baylor to Florida. A consensus three-star prospect out of high school, Kalu redshirted in 2023 after not seeing any action as a true freshman. He played three games as a reserve defensive lineman in 2024, making one start and recording one solo tackle.

In 2025, Kalu played 281 total snaps, earning a 59.7 offensive grade, a 61.5 run-defense grade, a 68.4 tackling grade (49th among Big 12 defensive linemen) and a 54.0 pass-rushing grade from Pro Football Focus. He played in nine games, starting six, recording 11 total tackles (four solo) and 0.5 tackles for a loss.

247Sports ranks Kalu No. 705 overall and No. 48 among defensive linemen in the 2026 transfer cycle. On3 has him at No. 684 and No. 75, respectively.

He was on campus this weekend for an official visit.

Committed üêä pic.twitter.com/WU9S8wrBkV

‚Äî DK Kaluüá≥üá¨ü§¥üèø (@dk_kalu) January 5, 2026

Following transfer portal losses, including starter Michai Boireau, the Gators have five defensive linemen in 2026. Redshirt senior Jamari Lyons has starting potential, as does redshirt junior Brendan Bett. Kalu is a depth addition, but he will compete for a starting job. Florida also returns Joseph Mbatchou and Jeramiah McCloud, and freshman Kendall Guervil recently signed as well.

The dilemma is that Boireau primarily played nose tackle for Florida last year, which none of the names mentioned above have much experience at. Lyons could step into that role, opening the door for Bett and Kalu to rotate alongside him. Florida could also add another defensive lineman from the transfer portal.

At 6-foot-4-inches, 309 pounds, Kalu provides size and depth to the position room.

Kalu is the fourth official transfer portal addition of the 2026 cycle for Florida, following Baylor safety DJ Coleman, James Madison tight end Lacota Dippre and Georgia Tech wide receiver Bailey Stockton.

Florida is also expected to land Georgia Tech quarterback Aaron Philo and interior offensive lineman Harrison Moore.

title: Spartans offer highly-coveted FCS transfer WR following visit
description: Michigan State football has extended an offer to a high-level FCS transfer wide receiver following his recent visit
fullText:
Michigan State football has extended an offer to a high-level FCS transfer wide receiver following his recent visit.

East Tennessee State transfer wide receiver Jeremiah Harrison announced on Monday that he's received an offer from the Spartans. Harrison posted on his social media X account about the offer from the Spartans following his visit to Michigan State this past weekend.

Harrision racked up 38 catches for 652 yards and five touchdowns during his freshman season with the Buccaneers. He will have three years of eligibility remaining.

Harrison is rated as a three-star prospect by 247Sports, and ranked as the No. 43 wide receiver in the portal class. He is also listed as the No. 175 overall prospect in the portal by 247Sports.

It appears this transfer portal recruiting battle is down to Michigan State and Ole Miss at this time. He has visited both the Spartans and Rebels, and also holds offers from both. There certainly could be some other teams that enter the mix, but at the moment those are the two reportedly showing the most interest in Harrison.

title: Should the Boston Celtics go all-in and be buyers at the 2026 NBA trade deadline?
description: The frontcourt stands out in particular as an area of need, with the Celtics needing a bit of veteran experience and a different style of big play.
fullText:
Should the Boston Celtics go all-in and be buyers at the 2026 NBA trade deadline? Given the fact that star Celtics forward Jaylen Brown has been playing at the level of a bona fide Most Valuable Player candidate so far this season and that Boston has defied the odds alongside him to claw their way up to the Eastern Conference's third-place spot, there is a very strong case that they ought to be on the hunt for some talent to add to the roster.

The frontcourt stands out in particular as an area of need, with the Celtics needing a little bit of veteran experience and a different style of big man play to put next to blossoming young big man Neemias Queta. The folks behind the "WEEI Boston's Sports Original" YouTube channel put together a clip from their "Greg Hill" show that takes a deeper look at what Boston ought to do in light of their unexpected success this season.

Take a look at the clip embedded below to hear what they had to say about potential Celtics trades and more.

title: Announcers for Panthers' wild-card game vs. Rams are revealed
description: The broadcast team for the Panthers' wild-card matchup against the Rams have been revealed, and Carolina fans should be stoked.
fullText:
Well, there'll be at least one Carolina Panthers legend in the building for Saturday's wild-card matchup against the Los Angeles Rams. The thing is, he'll be on the job.

As revealed on Monday, franchise great Greg Olsen will be on FOX's broadcast team for this weekend's playoff game from Bank of America Stadium. Olsen, as usual, will be joined by play-by-by commentator Joe Davis and sideline reporter Pam Oliver.

Before becoming an Emmy Award-winning color analyst, Olsen played nine of his 14 NFL seasons with the Panthers. The former three-time Pro Bowl tight end finished up as the Carolina's third all-time leading pass catcher, amassing 6,463 receiving yards between 2011 and 2019.

Olsen, perhaps fittingly, was a part of the Panthers' last playoff team‚Äîback in 2017. That trip ended in a wild-card round loss to the New Orleans Saints, where Olsen reeled in eight catches for 107 yards and a touchdown.

This will mark Olsen's fourth time covering the Panthers this season, with his last assignment coming in the team's Week 9 victory over the Green Bay Packers.

Follow¬†@ThePanthersWire¬†on Twitter/X for more Panthers content.

title: Oklahoma jumps to No. 5 in latest AP Poll
description: Some losses ahead combined with the Sooners' rolling of A&M and Mississippi State to give OU a lift in the poll.
fullText:
The Oklahoma women's basketball team jumped three spots in the Associated Press Poll released Monday.

OU knocked off Texas A&M on the road by 22 points and rolled over Mississippi State at home, 95-47, on Sunday, to open Southeastern Conference play.

Room was made higher in the poll after Maryland fell in its Big Ten opener and dropped from seventh to eighth. Michigan lost to Washington, knocking the Wolverines down from sixth to ninth. LSU lost to Vanderbilt, sending the Tigers from seventh to 12th. And Texas Christian lost to Utah, dropping the Horned Frogs from a tie for 8th with Oklahoma into 13th.

The top four teams in the poll did not change as Connecticut and Texas held the top two spots as undefeated teams, alongside the Commodores, with South Carolina and UCLA at No. 3 and No. 4.

Oklahoma hosts No. 18 Ole Miss on Thursday at Lloyd Noble Center and travels to Lexington to play No. 6 Kentucky on Sunday.

The complete poll can be seen below.

Others receiving votes: Illinois 58, Notre Dame 27, Stanford 25, NC State 22, Alabama 13, West Virginia 9, Georgia 5, Duke 3, Oklahoma St. 1.

title: Top committed EDGE prospects early on in the 2027 cycle
description: Transfer Portal season may be in full swing, but high school football recruiting won‚Äôt be slowing down this winter, either. Attention has nearly turned in full to the 2027 cycle. All-American games will round out this month and then it‚Äôll be on to camp season. Visits will be taken and early commitments will be made. [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Transfer Portal season may be in full swing, but high school football recruiting won‚Äôt be slowing down this winter, either.

Attention has nearly turned in full to the 2027 cycle. All-American games will round out this month and then it‚Äôll be on to camp season. Visits will be taken and early commitments will be made. Looking at the top EDGE prospects in the cycle, many are already off the board.

As of Jan. 5, eight of the 32 blue-chip EDGE recruits in the 2027 cycle are committed. That includes the No. 2 prospect at the position in five-star David Jacobs, who made a last-second pivot to Ohio State on Dec. 29. Below is a look at the top committed EDGEs early on in the cycle.

School: Blessed Trinity Catholic (Ga.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 10 NATL. (No. 2 EDGE)

On his commitment: ‚ÄúI love everything about Ohio State,‚Äù Jacobs told Rivals‚Äô Chad Simmons. ‚ÄúI was there for the Rutgers game and that visit really blew me away. The coaches, the players, and the atmosphere made a big impact on me. I knew about Ohio State and had been following them for a long time, but that visit showed me a lot.‚Äù

School: Irmo (S.C.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 34 NATL. (No. 5 EDGE)

On his commitment: ‚ÄúCoach (Sterling) Lucas is a coach I trust and believe in,‚Äù Bryant told Simmons. ‚ÄúSouth Carolina wasn‚Äôt one of my first offers, but he was recruiting me before that. He started recruiting me early, and he‚Äôs like family. He‚Äôs easy to talk to, we have a nice relationship, and he‚Äôs always been a coach I knew I would love to play for ‚Ä¶ LSU has a storied history. They‚Äôve always developed players, and it‚Äôs a good school with a lot of success.‚Äù

School: Vigor (Ala.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 88 NATL. (No. 10 EDGE)

On his commitment: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still open with my options,‚Äù Garror told Rivals‚Äô Adam Gorney in November. ‚ÄúJust waiting it out and talking with everyone that I can.‚Äù

Via Gorney: ‚ÄúThere are three main contenders working to flip the Mobile Vigor standout with¬†Auburn,¬†Florida State¬†and¬†Texas A&M¬†being the biggest threats to Alabama in his recruitment.‚Äù

School: Cy Falls (Texas)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 115 NATL. (No. 17 EDGE)

On his commitment: ‚ÄúAfter the first and second visits, I got to really talk to Coach Elko and the whole staff and they really expressed how much they wanted me,‚Äù McCarty told Rivals‚Äô Sam Spiegelman. ‚ÄúCoach (Jay) Bateman, Coach (Sean) Spencer and Coach Tony (Jerod-Eddie) all played roles. They just pushed the hardest and they know that I‚Äôm a family person ‚Äî and they got the closest with my family.‚Äù

School: Wayzata (Minn.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 119 NATL. (No. 18 EDGE)

Scout‚Äôs Take:¬†‚ÄúEli Diane is one that we really ranked high in our initial rankings and we continue to like what we see from the Minnesota commit. A lot of the tools we like to see from prospects at his position, we could see where he could continue to grow and become a defensive lineman long-term. A ton of developmental upside there, we like the film and feel like he‚Äôs just scratching the surface on his potential.‚Äù

School: Muskegon (Mich.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 126 NATL. (No. 19 EDGE)

On Michigan: ‚ÄúWe went to a lot of colleges and, when we got there, it was different,‚Äù¬†Kitchen told The Wolverine‚Äôs Ethan McDowell¬†in September. ‚ÄúEverybody was huge. They were really hitting out there, really putting in work and it was just different.‚Äù

School: Ridgeline (Utah)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 135 NATL. (No. 20 EDGE)

On his commitment: ‚ÄúIt was in the back of my head for the last month-and-a-half with the communication they‚Äôve had and just seeing their defense and how crazy it is these past few years,‚Äù Jones told Rivals‚Äô Adam Gorney. ‚ÄúLooking back on the coaches and how they develop kids and how I could trust myself in their hands to get me to where I want to be.‚Äù

School: Grimsley (N.C.)
Rivals Industry Ranking: No. 282 NATL. (No. 28 EDGE)

Rogers on new VT head coach James Franklin: ‚ÄúIt changes some things for me,‚Äù he told Rivals. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure they will reach back out and Blacksburg is still my first love. I would love it make it work again with them if possible ‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs definitely a great hire. I‚Äôve heard nothing but great things about him.‚Äù

title: Mike McDaniel's Dolphins head into offseason looking for a new GM and with a big QB question
description: Mike McDaniel's job as head coach of the Miami Dolphins appears to be safe for now.  ‚ÄúListen, I was hired here to not just be the head coach,‚Äù McDaniel said Monday, a day after the Dolphins were blown out at New England to finish the season 7-10.  ‚ÄúI was hired to return a storied franchise to winning regular-season games, playoff games and Super Bowls.‚Äù
fullText:
MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) ‚Äî Mike McDaniel's job as head coach of the Miami Dolphins appears to be safe for now. He knows that will only remain true if he produces the results he was hired for in 2022.

‚ÄúListen, I was hired here to not just be the head coach,‚Äù McDaniel said Monday, a day after the Dolphins were blown out at New England to finish the season 7-10. ‚ÄúI was hired to return a storied franchise to winning regular-season games, playoff games and Super Bowls.‚Äù

The latter two have not happened. And after another season of failed expectations in which the Dolphins missed the playoffs for the second straight year, they enter another offseason of uncertainty, starting with who'll be their next general manager and starting quarterback in 2026.

McDaniel, who is 35-32 in four seasons as Miami's coach, indicated Monday that he will be part of the decision-making in both processes. Though he did not specifically say he has been told by Dolphins ownership that he's returning next season ‚Äî nor has the team made an official announcement ‚Äî McDaniel said he has spoken with owner Stephen Ross.

‚ÄúI know one thing, every day that I'm employed by the Miami Dolphins as the head coach, I'm solely focused on doing what I was hired here to do,‚Äù McDaniel said. "Eventually, like everybody else in this league, you're not entitled to this position. If I'm not able to win regular-season games, playoff games and Super Bowls, eventually the job won't be mine.

"And I think that is the nature of the NFL, and shame on you if you expect anything else.‚Äù

The Dolphins parted ways with longtime general manager Chris Grier on Oct. 31 following a loss to the Baltimore Ravens that dropped them to 2-7. Dolphins senior personnel executive Champ Kelly has been Miami's interim GM since, and the team recently brought in Hall of Fame quarterback Troy Aikman to aid in its GM search.

‚ÄúI'm going to be a part of the (interview) process,‚Äù McDaniel said, ‚Äúand beyond that, I think the main objective and what everyone's counting on is that we have a cohesive crew of people that are working in the same direction. I'm happy to support all of that. It's not my decision to make, nor do I think that would be an intelligent way to go about business.‚Äù

Beyond front office decisions, the Dolphins will need to figure out what they're going to do at quarterback after Tua Tagovailoa was benched for the final three games of the season because of poor play.

McDaniel said Monday there will be a quarterback competition to determine Miami's 2026 starter, and he will meet with Tagovailoa on Tuesday morning to discuss the season.

Tagovailoa threw for 2,660 yards with 20 touchdowns but showed a stark decline in accuracy and mobility, just one season after signing a four-year, $212.4 million extension in July 2024. He finished second in the NFL with 15 interceptions, which was a career high.

Tagovailoa is guaranteed $54 million for 2026, and the Dolphins would incur significant hits to the salary cap by releasing him. Releasing him next year would result in a $99 million dead cap charge. If the move is designated as a post-June 1 release, those charges are split over two years, with $67.4 million allocated to the 2026 cap and $31.8 million in 2027.

Rookie seventh-round pick Quinn Ewers went 1-2 as Miami's starter but didn't separate himself as the clear No. 1 option for 2026, throwing for 569 yards, three touchdowns and three interceptions. And the Dolphins recently signed rookie sixth-round pick Cam Miller off the Raiders' practice squad to join the competition.

Despite a second consecutive losing season that ensured the Dolphins' 25-year playoff win drought will remain intact, McDaniel apparently has the backing of Ross. And the two will meet again later this week to discuss the organization's future.

‚ÄúWe both share the same sentiment that we‚Äôre not where we want to be,‚Äù McDaniel said. "We‚Äôre not just dismissing this season as, ‚ÄòOops, we‚Äôll try again.‚Äô‚Äù

The Dolphins will also need to figure out what to do with the contract of star receiver Tyreek Hill, who'll be 32 in March and suffered a severe knee injury in September.

The Dolphins acquired Hill in a trade with Kansas City in 2022 and gave him a $120 million, four-year contract extension, which he restructured in 2024 and runs through 2026.

Hill is owed about $29.9 million next season, though $11 million of that becomes guaranteed after the start of the new league year, which is also when the Dolphins will have to pay him a $5 million roster bonus.

Hill would carry a $51.9 million cap hit if the Dolphins release him.

McDaniel doesn't believe the organization is heading toward a complete rebuild. Regardless, the new GM will have several core pieces to build around, including third-year running back De'Von Achane, second-year left tackle Patrick Paul, veteran center Aaron Brewer and veteran linebacker Jordyn Brooks.

Achane had one of the best seasons of any Dolphins running back, and Brooks, who said Monday he hopes to remain in Miami the rest of his career, led the NFL with 183 tackles.

A couple players set to hit free agency have expressed interest in returning to to the Dolphins, including veteran tight end Darren Waller.

Waller came out of retirement to play in Miami on a one-year deal last July but was limited to nine games because of injuries. Still, Waller caught 24 of 34 targets for six touchdowns. The 33-year-old said he's undecided on whether he will return to football next season, but said he will make a decision soon and is considering returning to Miami.

Once the new GM is in place, the Dolphins will likely need to get an earlier start on free agency than they did last season. They also have the 11th pick in the NFL draft.

title: TST Best Bets- January 5, 2026
description: Monday‚Äôs NBA and NHL slates present plenty of betting opportunities as teams hit midseason form and trends across both leagues turn into dependable indicators.
fullText:
Monday‚Äôs NBA and NHL slates present plenty of betting opportunities as teams hit midseason form and trends across both leagues turn into dependable indicators. As January rolls on, separation on the hardwood and ice sharpens betting lines, creating clearer opportunities at the window. ¬†Here are tonight‚Äôs best bets brought to you by BetOnline.ag. Rundown: The Los Angeles Kings (17-14-9) wrap up a two-game home set against the Minnesota Wild (25-10-8) on Monday night at Crypto.com Arena.

Los Angeles enters tonight‚Äôs contest riding the momentum of a 5-4 shootout win over Minnesota on Saturday, a result that stood out given the Kings‚Äô season-long offensive struggles. Ranked 31st in goals per game, Los Angeles capitalized on its chances against a Wild team that had won eight of its previous 10 contests, with Adrian Kempe recording a two-point night to spark the breakthrough performance. While the final score reflected a wide-open game, much of the damage came from situational lapses rather than sustained offensive pressure.

Despite Saturday‚Äôs nine-goal outburst, both teams continue to lean on structure and goal prevention as their foundation. The Kings rank third in the NHL in goals allowed per game (2.65), relying on disciplined defensive-zone coverage and limiting high-danger chances, a style that has pushed 22 of their 40 games (55%) below the posted total. Minnesota enters with a similar identity, excelling at controlling tempo and suppressing second-chance opportunities.

Expect a sharper, more methodical approach in the rematch, with both teams tightening neutral-zone play and limiting rush chances. With goaltending and defensive structure likely to dictate the pace, this matchup sets up for a lower-scoring outcome this time around.

Rundown: The Los Angeles Clippers (12-22) close out a five-game homestand on Monday night as they host the Golden State Warriors (19-17) at Intuit Dome.

Los Angeles looks to rebound after a 31-point blowout loss to Boston that snapped its six-game winning streak and dropped the Clippers back to 10 games under the .500 mark. Jaylen Brown‚Äôs 50-point outburst exposed some of Los Angeles‚Äô season-long offensive issues, as the Clippers continue to rank near the bottom of the league in scoring efficiency. Despite the uneven record, Los Angeles‚Äô recent surge has translated to the betting market, covering seven of its last 10 games and posting an 8‚Äì8 record against the spread when listed as underdogs of 2.5 points or more. Kawhi Leonard and James Harden will be tasked with generating efficient looks against a Golden State defense that ranks seventh in the NBA in points allowed (113.9 per game) and does a strong job limiting perimeter scoring.

On the other side, Golden State enters playing its best basketball in weeks, winning six of its last eight contests behind the continued brilliance of Stephen Curry. At 37 years old, Curry remains the engine of the Warriors‚Äô offense, averaging 28.8 points per game, ninth-highest in the league. While Golden State‚Äôs recent success has boosted its position in the standings, it has not consistently carried over to the betting window, as the Warriors have covered just three of their last 10 games and sit 15-21 ATS on the season. As favorites of 2.5 points or more, Golden State has struggled to separate, owning a 9-14-1 ATS record in those spots.

Expect Los Angeles to lean on home-court energy and create opportunities in key spots, keeping this matchup within a single possession as the final buzzer sounds.

title: Rangers goaltender Igor Shesterkin leaves game against the Mammoth because of injury
description: New York Rangers goaltender Igor Shesterkin left his team‚Äôs game Monday night against Utah midway through the first period with an apparent left leg injury.  Shesterkin‚Äôs leg bent awkwardly with his skate on the ice as he attempted to avoid contact with Mammoth forward JJ Peterka, who was on the edge of the crease.  Peterka did not appear to make contact with Shesterkin, who lay down in the net in pain while he was attended to by a trainer.
fullText:
NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî New York Rangers goaltender Igor Shesterkin left his team‚Äôs game Monday night against Utah midway through the first period with an apparent left leg injury.

Shesterkin‚Äôs leg bent awkwardly with his skate on the ice as he attempted to avoid contact with Mammoth forward JJ Peterka, who was on the edge of the crease. Peterka did not appear to make contact with Shesterkin, who lay down in the net in pain while he was attended to by a trainer.

The 30-year-old face of the franchise was helped off the ice by the trainer and defenseman Vladislav Gavrikov and did not put any weight on his left foot. Veteran backup Jonathan Quick replaced Shesterkin.

Shesterkin won the Vezina Trophy as the NHL's top goalie in 2022 and is in the first season of an eight-year, $92 million contract that made him the highest-paid player at the position in league history. The Russia native from Moscow is 17-12-4 with a 2.47 goals-against average and .912 save percentage this season, his seventh with the Rangers.

title: Nvidia Kicks Off the Next Generation of AI with Rubin ‚Äì Six New Chips
description: NVIDIA today kickstarted the next generation of AI with the launch of the NVIDIA Rubin platform, comprising six new chips designed to deliver one incredible AI supercomputer.
fullText:
CES‚ÄîNVIDIA today kickstarted the next generation of AI with the launch of the NVIDIA Rubin platform, comprising six new chips designed to deliver one incredible AI supercomputer. NVIDIA Rubin sets a new standard for building, deploying and securing the world‚Äôs largest and most advanced AI systems at the lowest cost to accelerate mainstream AI adoption.

The Rubin platform uses extreme codesign across the six chips ‚Äî the NVIDIA Vera CPU, NVIDIA Rubin GPU, NVIDIA NVLink‚Ñ¢ 6 Switch, NVIDIA ConnectX¬Æ-9 SuperNIC, NVIDIA BlueField¬Æ-4 DPU and NVIDIA Spectrum‚Ñ¢-6 Ethernet Switch ‚Äî to slash training time and inference token costs.

‚ÄúRubin arrives at exactly the right moment, as AI computing demand for both training and inference is going through the roof,‚Äù said Jensen Huang, founder and CEO of NVIDIA. ‚ÄúWith our annual cadence of delivering a new generation of AI supercomputers ‚Äî and extreme codesign across six new chips ‚Äî Rubin takes a giant leap toward the next frontier of AI.‚Äù

Named for Vera Florence Cooper Rubin ‚Äî the trailblazing American astronomer whose discoveries transformed humanity‚Äôs understanding of the universe ‚Äî the Rubin platform features the NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72 rack-scale solution and the NVIDIA HGX Rubin NVL8 system.

The Rubin platform introduces five innovations, including the latest generations of NVIDIA NVLink interconnect technology, Transformer Engine, Confidential Computing and RAS Engine, as well as the NVIDIA Vera CPU. These breakthroughs will accelerate agentic AI, advanced reasoning and massive-scale mixture-of-experts (MoE) model inference at up to 10x lower cost per token of the NVIDIA Blackwell platform. Compared with its predecessor, the NVIDIA Rubin platform trains MoE models with 4x fewer¬†GPUs to accelerate AI adoption.

Broad Ecosystem Support

Among the world‚Äôs leading AI labs, cloud service providers, computer makers and startups expected to adopt Rubin are Amazon Web Services (AWS), Anthropic, Black Forest Labs, Cisco, Cohere, CoreWeave, Cursor, Dell Technologies, Google, Harvey, HPE, Lambda, Lenovo, Meta, Microsoft, Mistral AI, Nebius, Nscale, OpenAI, OpenEvidence, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), Perplexity, Runway, Supermicro, Thinking Machines Lab and xAI.

Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI: ‚ÄúIntelligence scales with compute. When we add more compute, models get more capable, solve harder problems and make a bigger impact for people. The NVIDIA Rubin platform helps us keep scaling this progress so advanced intelligence benefits everyone.‚Äù

Dario Amodei, cofounder and CEO of Anthropic: ‚ÄúThe efficiency gains in the NVIDIA Rubin platform represent the kind of infrastructure progress that enables longer memory, better reasoning and more reliable outputs. Our collaboration with NVIDIA helps power our safety research and our frontier models.‚Äù

Mark Zuckerberg, founder and CEO of Meta: ‚ÄúNVIDIA‚Äôs Rubin platform promises to deliver the step-change in performance and efficiency required to deploy the most advanced models to billions of people.‚Äù

Elon Musk, founder and CEO of xAI: ‚ÄúüíöüéâüöÄ ü§ñNVIDIA Rubin will be a rocket engine for AI. If you want to train and deploy frontier models at scale, this is the infrastructure you use ‚Äî and Rubin will remind the world that NVIDIA is the gold standard.üíöüéâüöÄ ü§ñ‚Äù

Satya Nadella, executive chairman and CEO of Microsoft: ‚ÄúWe are building the world‚Äôs most powerful AI superfactories to serve any workload, anywhere, with maximum performance and efficiency. With the addition of NVIDIA Vera Rubin GPUs, we will empower developers and organizations to create, reason and scale in entirely new ways.‚Äù

Mike Intrator, cofounder and CEO of CoreWeave: ‚ÄúWe built CoreWeave to help pioneers accelerate their innovations with the unmatched performance of our purpose-built AI platform, matching the right technology to the right workloads as they evolve. The NVIDIA Rubin platform represents an important advancement for reasoning, agentic and large-scale inference workloads, and we‚Äôre excited to add it to our platform. With CoreWeave Mission Control as the operating standard, we can integrate new capabilities quickly and run them reliably at production scale, working in close partnership with NVIDIA.‚Äù

Matt Garman, CEO of AWS: ‚ÄúAWS and NVIDIA have been driving cloud AI innovation together for more than 15 years. The NVIDIA Rubin platform on AWS represents our continued commitment to delivering cutting-edge AI infrastructure that gives customers unmatched choice and flexibility. By combining NVIDIA‚Äôs advanced AI technology with AWS‚Äôs proven scale, security and comprehensive AI services, customers can build, train and deploy their most demanding AI applications faster and more cost effectively ‚Äî accelerating their path from experimentation to production at any scale.‚Äù

Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet: ‚ÄúWe are proud of our deep and long-standing relationship with NVIDIA. To meet the substantial customer demand we see for NVIDIA GPUs, we are focused on providing the best possible environment for their hardware on Google Cloud. Our collaboration will continue as we bring the impressive capabilities of the Rubin platform to our customers, offering them the scale and performance needed to advance the boundaries of AI.‚Äù

Clay Magouyrk, CEO of Oracle: ‚ÄúOracle Cloud Infrastructure is a hyperscale cloud built for the highest performance, and together with NVIDIA, we‚Äôre pushing the boundaries of what customers can build and scale with AI. With gigascale AI factories powered by the NVIDIA Vera Rubin architecture, OCI is giving customers the infrastructure foundation they need to push the limits of model training, inference and real-world AI impact.‚Äù

Michael Dell, chairman and CEO of Dell Technologies: ‚ÄúThe NVIDIA Rubin platform represents a major leap forward in AI infrastructure. By integrating Rubin into the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA, we‚Äôre building infrastructure that can handle massive token volumes and multistep reasoning while delivering the performance and resiliency that enterprises and neoclouds need to deploy AI at scale.‚Äù

Antonio Neri, president and CEO of HPE: ‚ÄúAI is reshaping not just workloads but the very foundations of IT, requiring us to reimagine every layer of infrastructure from the network to the compute. With the NVIDIA Vera Rubin platform, HPE is building the next generation of secure, AI-native infrastructure, turning data into intelligence and enabling enterprises to become true AI factories.‚Äù

Yuanqing Yang, chairman and CEO of Lenovo: ‚ÄúLenovo is embracing the next-generation NVIDIA Rubin platform, leveraging our Neptune liquid-cooling solution as well as our global scale, manufacturing efficiency and service reach, to help enterprises build AI factories that serve as intelligent, accelerated engines for insight and innovation. Together, we‚Äôre architecting an AI-driven future where efficient, secure AI becomes the standard for every organization.‚Äù

Engineered to Scale Intelligence

Agentic AI and reasoning models, along with state-of-the-art video generation workloads, are redefining the limits of computation. Multistep problem-solving requires models to process, reason and act across long sequences of tokens. Designed to serve the demands of complex AI workloads, the Rubin platform‚Äôs five groundbreaking technologies include:

AI-Native Storage and Secure, Software-Defined Infrastructure

NVIDIA Rubin introduces NVIDIA Inference Context Memory Storage Platform, a new class of AI-native storage infrastructure designed to scale inference context at gigascale.

As AI factories increasingly adopt bare-metal and multi-tenant deployment models, maintaining strong infrastructure control and isolation becomes essential.

BlueField-4 also introduces Advanced Secure Trusted Resource Architecture, or ASTRA, a system-level trust architecture that gives AI infrastructure builders a single, trusted control point to securely provision, isolate and operate large-scale AI environments without compromising performance.

With AI applications evolving toward multi-turn agentic reasoning, AI-native organizations must manage and share far larger volumes of inference context across users, sessions and services.

Different Forms for Different Workloads

NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72 offers a unified, secure system that combines 72 NVIDIA Rubin GPUs, 36 NVIDIA Vera CPUs, NVIDIA NVLink 6, NVIDIA ConnectX-9 SuperNICs and NVIDIA BlueField-4 DPUs.

NVIDIA will also offer the NVIDIA HGX Rubin NVL8 platform, a server board that links eight Rubin GPUs through NVLink to support x86-based generative AI platforms. The HGX Rubin NVL8 platform accelerates training, inference and scientific computing for AI and high-performance computing workloads.

NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD‚Ñ¢ serves as a reference for deploying Rubin-based systems at scale, integrating either NVIDIA DGX Vera Rubin NVL72 or DGX Rubin NVL8 systems with NVIDIA BlueField-4 DPUs, NVIDIA ConnectX-9 SuperNICs, NVIDIA InfiniBand networking and NVIDIA Mission Control‚Ñ¢ software.

Next-Generation Ethernet Networking

Advanced Ethernet networking and storage are components of AI infrastructure critical to keeping data centers running at full speed, improving performance and efficiency, and lowering costs.

NVIDIA Spectrum-6 Ethernet is the next generation of Ethernet for AI networking, built to scale Rubin-based AI factories with higher efficiency and greater resilience, and enabled by 200G SerDes communication circuitry, co-packaged optics and AI-optimized fabrics.

Built on the Spectrum-6 architecture, Spectrum-X Ethernet Photonics co-packaged optical switch systems deliver 10x greater reliability and 5x longer uptime for AI applications while achieving 5x better power efficiency, maximizing performance per watt compared with traditional methods. Spectrum-XGS Ethernet technology, part of the Spectrum-X Ethernet platform, enables facilities separated by hundreds of kilometers and more to function as a single AI environment.

Together, these innovations define the next generation of the NVIDIA Spectrum-X Ethernet platform, engineered with extreme codesign for Rubin to enable massive-scale AI factories and pave the way for future million-GPU environments.

Rubin Readiness

NVIDIA Rubin is in full production, and Rubin-based products will be available from partners the second half of 2026.

Among the first cloud providers to deploy Vera Rubin-based instances in 2026 will be AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft and OCI, as well as NVIDIA Cloud Partners CoreWeave, Lambda, Nebius and Nscale.

Microsoft will deploy NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72 rack-scale systems as part of next-generation AI data centers, including future Fairwater AI superfactory sites.

Designed to deliver unprecedented efficiency and performance for training and inference workloads, the Rubin platform will provide the foundation for Microsoft‚Äôs next-generation cloud AI capabilities. Microsoft Azure will offer a tightly optimized platform enabling customers to accelerate innovation across enterprise, research and consumer applications.

CoreWeave will integrate NVIDIA Rubin-based systems into its AI cloud platform beginning in the second half of 2026. CoreWeave is built to operate multiple architectures side by side, enabling customers to bring Rubin into their environments, where it will deliver the greatest impact across training, inference and agentic workloads.

Together with NVIDIA, CoreWeave will help AI pioneers take advantage of Rubin‚Äôs advancements in reasoning and MoE models, while continuing to deliver the performance, operational reliability and scale required for production AI across the full lifecycle with CoreWeave Mission Control.

In addition, Cisco, Dell, HPE, Lenovo and Supermicro are expected to deliver a wide range of servers based on Rubin products.

AI labs including Anthropic, Black Forest, Cohere, Cursor, Harvey, Meta, Mistral AI, OpenAI, OpenEvidence, Perplexity, Runway, Thinking Machines Lab and xAI are looking to the NVIDIA Rubin platform to train larger, more capable models and to serve long-context, multimodal systems at lower latency and cost than with prior GPU generations.

Infrastructure software and storage partners AIC, Canonical, Cloudian, DDN, Dell, HPE, Hitachi Vantara, IBM, NetApp, Nutanix, Pure Storage, Supermicro, SUSE, VAST Data and WEKA are working with NVIDIA to design next-generation platforms for Rubin infrastructure.

The Rubin platform marks NVIDIA‚Äôs third-generation rack-scale architecture, with more than 80 NVIDIA MGX‚Ñ¢ ecosystem partners.

To unlock this density, Red Hat today announced an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA to deliver a complete AI stack optimized for the NVIDIA Rubin platform with Red Hat‚Äôs hybrid cloud portfolio, including Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Red Hat OpenShift and Red Hat AI. These solutions are used by the vast majority of Fortune Global 500 companies.

Learn more by watching NVIDIA Live at CES and reading the ‚ÄúInside Vera Rubin‚Äù technical blog.
